meanings.definition: Neat and orderly in appearance or arrangement.
meanings.sent1: Her room was always tidy and clean.
meanings.sent2: The librarian kept the books on the shelf tidy.
meanings.sent3: The tidy desk looked like a picture from a magazine.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a tidy patchwork of colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The tidy rows of vegetables in the garden were a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: To make (something) neat or orderly by cleaning or organizing.
meanings.sent1: She would tidy up her room before guests arrived.
meanings.sent2: Please tidy your toys before going to bed.
meanings.sent3: He tried to tidy up the chaos of his thoughts.
meanings.sent4: She tidied the kitchen as if preparing for a royal visit.
meanings.sent5: The maid tidied the room with swift efficiency.

meanings.sent1: He only needed a tidy of sugar for his coffee.
meanings.sent2: She added a tidy of salt to the soup for flavor.
meanings.sent3: The recipe called for a tidy of spices to enhance the taste.
meanings.sent4: A tidy of coins jingled in his pocket.
meanings.sent5: She put a tidy of flowers in the vase to brighten the room.
